member.remarks: This will also split the table of contents if any entry has the "split" option. Likewise, a default topic in the conceptual content will take precedence over a default topic in the additional content.

member.remarks: This can be used by any plug-in that does not produce a reflection information file using MRefBuilder.exe. In such cases, the API filter is not applied unless the plug-in uses this method. If the reflection information file is produced by MRefBuilder.exe, there is no need to use this method as it will apply the API filter automatically to the file that it produces.

member.summary: Force garbage collection to reduce memory usage.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.BuildProcess.VerifySafePath(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Make sure the path isn't one the user would regret having nuked without warning.
member.param: The name of the path property
The path to the current project
member.remarks:
Since most people don't read the help file and also ignore the warning in the property grid description pane, we'll take some steps to idiot-proof the dangerous path properties. I'm starting to lose count of the number of people that point WorkingPath at the root of their C:\ drive and wonder why all their files disappear.
Paths checked for include root references to hard drives and network shares, most common well-known folders, and the project's root folder.
member.exception: This is thrown if the path is one of the ones that probably should not be used.

member.exception: This is thrown if the format is not HtmlHelp1, MSHelp2, or Website.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.BuildProcess.CopyStandardHelpContent
member.summary: This is called to create the help project output folder and copy the standard content files (art, media, scripts, and styles) to the help project folder.
member.remarks: This creates the folders Output\ and Output\html under the working folder and copies the stock art, icon, media, script, and style sheet files from the {@PresentationPath}\art, {@PresentationPath}\icons, {@PresentationPath}\media, {@PresentationPath}\scripts, and {@PresentationPath}\styles folders which are located in the Sandcastle installation folder. The art, icons, and media folders may or may not exist based on the style.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Load a Sandcastle Builder project from the given filename.

member.exception: This is thrown if a filename is not specified or if it does not exist and mustExist is true.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.#ctor(Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Project,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This is used to create a Sandcastle Builder project from an existing MSBuild project instance.
member.param: True to load final values (i.e. for build) or false to load design-time values.
member.remarks: It is assumed that the project has been loaded, the property values are current, and, if using final values, that the configuration and platform have been set in the MSBuild project global properties.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.#ctor(SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This is used to clone an existing project in order to build it without affecting the existing project's properties.
member.param: True to load final values (i.e. for build) or false to load design-time values.
member.remarks: This is used to perform partial builds where we may want to use alternate property values.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.MarkAsDirty
member.summary: This is used to mark the project as dirty and in need of being saved.
member.event: This event is raised to let interested parties know that the project's dirty state has been changed.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.DefaultBuildAction(System.String)
member.summary: This is used to determine the default build action for a file based on its extension.
member.returns: The build action based on the extension

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.AddFolderToProject(System.String)
member.summary: Add a new folder build item to the project
member.returns: The new .
member.remarks: If the folder does not exist in the project, it is added and created if not already there. If the folder is already part of the project, the existing item is returned.
member.exception: This is thrown if the path matches the project root path or is not below it.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.AddFileToProject(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add a new file build item to the project
member.param: The optional destination path. If empty, null, or it does not start with the project folder, the file is copied to the root folder of the project.
member.returns: The new .
member.remarks: If the file does not exist in the project, it is copied to the destination path or project folder if not already there. The default build action is determined based on the filename's extension. If the file is already part of the project, the existing item is returned.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.FindFile(System.String)
member.summary: This is used to locate a file by name in the project
member.param: The fully qualified file path to find
member.returns: The file item if found or null if not found

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.EnsureProjectIsCurrent(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This is used to ensure that all local collection project properties have been stored in the MSBuild project file and that path-type properties are current based on the current project location.
member.param: True to force an update of all affected properties or false to only update those that need it.
member.remarks: This only affects the property-based collection properties and path-type properties. Simple types and item group element properties are stored when modified. This will also ensure that the SHFBSchemaVersion is set to the current version too.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.OutputPath
member.summary: This is used to set or get the path to which the help files will be generated.
member.remarks:
The default is to create it in a folder called Help in the same folder as the project file.
Warning: If building a web site, the output folder's prior content will be erased without warning prior to copying the new web site content to it!

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.SandcastlePath
member.summary: This is used to set or get the path to the Sandcastle components
member.value: You only need to set this if the builder cannot determine the path for itself.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.WorkingPath
member.summary: This is used to set or get the path to the working folder used during the build process to store the intermediate files.
member.value:
This can be used to perform the build in a different location with a shorter path if you encounter errors due to long file path names. If not specified, it defaults to a folder called .\Working under the folder specified by the property.
Warning: All files and folders in the path specified in this property will be erased without warning when the build starts.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.CleanIntermediates
member.summary: This is used to set or get whether intermediate files are deleted after a successful build.
member.value: The default value is true.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.KeepLogFile
member.summary: This is used to set or get whether or not the log file is retained after a successful build.
member.value: The default value is true.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.BuildLogFile
member.summary: This is used to set or get the path and filename of the build log file.
member.value: If not specified, a default name of LastBuild.log is used and the file is saved in the path identified in the property.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.HelpFileFormat
member.summary: This is used to set or get the help file format generated by the build process.
member.value: The default is to produce an HTML Help 1 format file built using HHC.exe.
member.remarks: If building a web site, the output folder will be cleared before the new content is copied to it.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.CppCommentsFixup
member.summary: This is used to set or get whether to fix-up the XML comments files to work around an issue with those generated by the C++ compiler.
member.value: The default value is false.
member.remarks: The C++ compiler generates method signatures that differ from the other .NET compilers for methods that take generics as parameters. These methods fail to get documented as they do not match the output of MRefBuilder. The C# and VB.NET compilers generate names that do match it and this option is not needed for comments files generated by them. Set this to true if the project contains C++ compiler generated XML comments files and your project contains methods that take generic types for parameters.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.FrameworkVersion
member.summary: This is used to set or get the .NET Framework version to which the documentation links for system types should point.
member.remarks: If not found, it will default to the most recent version of the framework installed.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.ComponentConfigurations
member.summary: This is used to get a dictionary of build component configurations.
member.remarks: This allows you to configure the settings for third party build components if they support it.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.PlugInConfigurations
member.summary: This is used to get a dictionary of build process plug-in configurations.
member.remarks: This allows you to select and configure the settings for third party build process plug-ins.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.UserDefinedProperties

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.ShowMissingReturns
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not missing <returns> tags are indicated in the help file.
member.value: Set this to true to add a message to the help topic to indicate that the <returns> tag is missing. A message is also written to the log file.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.ShowMissingValues
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not missing <value> tags are indicated in the help file.
member.value: Set this to true to add a message to the help topic to indicate that the <value> tag is missing. A message is also written to the log file.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.ShowMissingRemarks
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not missing <remarks> tags are indicated in the help file.
member.value: Set this to true to add a message to the help topic to indicate that the <remarks> tag is missing. A message is also written to the log file.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.AutoDocumentConstructors
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not constructors are automatically documented if they are missing the <summary> tag and for classes with compiler generated constructors.
member.value: Set this to true to automatically add default text for the <summary> tag on constructors that are missing it and for classes with a compiler generated constructor. If set to false and is true, a "missing summary" warning will appear instead. A message is also written to the log file.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.AutoDocumentDisposeMethods
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not dispose methods are automatically documented if they are missing the <summary> tag and for classes with compiler generated dispose methods.
member.value: Set this to true to automatically add default text for the <summary> tag on dispose methods that are missing it and for classes with compiler generated dispose methods. If set to false and is true, a "missing summary" warning will appear instead. A message is also written to the log file. If a Dispose(Boolean) method is present, its parameter will also be auto-documented if necessary. If set to false and is true, a "missing parameter" message will appear instead.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.ShowMissingIncludeTargets
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not missing <include> tag target documentation is indicated in the help file.
member.value: Set this to true to add a message to the help topic to indicate that the <include> tag's target documentation is missing. A message is also written to the log file.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.DocumentAttributes
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not attributes on types and members are documented in the syntax portion of the help file.
member.value: Set to true to document attributes or false to hide them

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.DocumentExplicitInterfaceImplementations
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not explicit interface implementations are documented.
member.value: Set to true to document explicit interface implementations or false to hide them.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.DocumentInheritedMembers
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not inherited members are documented.
member.value: Set to true to document inherited members or false to hide them.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.DocumentInheritedFrameworkMembers
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not inherited framework members are documented.
member.value: Set to true to document inherited framework members or false to hide them. For this to work, must also be enabled.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.DocumentInheritedFrameworkPrivateMembers
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not inherited private framework members are documented.
member.value: Set to true to document inherited private framework members or false to hide them. For this to work, and must also be enabled.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.DocumentInheritedFrameworkInternalMembers
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not inherited internal framework members are documented.
member.value: Set to true to document inherited internal framework members or false to hide them. For this to work, and must also be enabled.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.DocumentInternals
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not internal members are documented in the help file.
member.value: Set to true to document internal members or false to hide them

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.DocumentPrivates
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not private members are documented in the help file.
member.value: Set to true to document private members or false to hide them

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.DocumentPrivateFields
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not private fields are documented in the help file.
member.value: Set to true to document private fields or false to hide them. For this to work, must also be enabled.
member.remarks: Private fields are most often used to back properties and do not have documentation. With this set to false, they are omitted from the help file to reduce unnecessary clutter.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.DocumentProtected
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not protected members are documented in the help file.
member.value: Set to true to document protected members or false to hide them

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.DocumentProtectedInternalAsProtected
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not "protected internal" members are documented as "protected" only in the help file.
member.value: Set to true to document "protected internal" members as "protected" only or false to document them normally. This option is ignored if is false.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.DocumentSealedProtected
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not protected members of sealed classes are documented in the help file.
member.value: Set to true to document protected members of sealed classes or false to hide them. For this to work, must also be enabled.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ConceptualContent.TocEntry.Children
member.summary: This returns the child table of contents collection for this entry
member.value: If empty, this is a single item in the table of contents. If it has children, they are listed below this one. A file may or may not be associated with this entry if it is a root node.

member.summary: This is used to get or set the entry's title in the table of contents.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ConceptualContent.TocEntry.IncludePage
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not the page will appear in the table of contents.
member.remarks: For root entries that have children, the node will appear in the table of contents but will have no page associated with it. The other options such as will still have an effect.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ConceptualContent.TocEntry.IsDefaultTopic
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not the item is the default topic for the help file.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ConceptualContent.TocEntry.HasLinks
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not the topic has links that need to be resolved when the file is copied.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ConceptualContent.TocEntry.NeedsColorizing
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not the topic has <pre> blocks that have a lang attribute to indicate that they should be colorized.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ConceptualContent.TocEntry.HasCodeBlocks
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not the topic has <code /> blocks that need expanding.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ConceptualContent.TocEntry.HasProjectTags
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not the topic has tags that should be resolved to project options.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ConceptualContent.TocEntry.SplitToc
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not the table of contents is split after this entry.
member.remarks: This is only valid on root entries and the first one seen will cause all items from that tiem onward to appear below the API content. All items prior to the entry will appear before the API content. If used, the ContentPlacement project property will be ignored.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ConceptualContent.TocEntry.SortOrder
member.summary: This is used to get or set the sort order for the entry within its group.
member.value: Entries with identical sort order values will sort by title as well. Items with not specific sort order will sort below those with a defined sort order.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Design.ApiFilterEditorDlg.LoadNamespaces
member.summary: This is used to load the reflection information file and to load the root namespace nodes into the tree view.
member.remarks:
The namespace nodes and type nodes are loaded on demand to reduce the time needed to create the tree view and to conserve some memory for extremely large builds.
Documented APIs are loaded into the first root node. Inherited APIs are loaded into the second node. By splitting the inherited stuff out, we can optimze the API filter and allow the user to get rid of unwanted inherited members with a single selection.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.FilePath.GetFullPath(System.String)
member.summary: This returns the fully qualified path for the specified path. This version allows wildcards in the filename part if present.
member.returns: The fully qualified path name
member.remarks: The System.IO.Path version of will throw an exception if the path contains wildcard characters. This version does not.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.FilePath.AbsoluteToRelativePath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This helper method can be used to convert an absolute path to one that is relative to the given base path.
member.returns: A path to the given absolute path that is relative to the given base path.
member.remarks: If the base path is null or empty, the current working folder is used.

example.code:
Dim basePath As String = "E:\DotNet\CS\TestProject\Source" Dim absolutePath As String = "E:\DotNet\CS\TestProject\Doc\Help.html"
Dim relativePath As String = _ FilePath.AbsoluteToRelativePath(basePath, absolutePath);
Console.WriteLine(relativePath)
' Results in: ..\Doc\Help.html

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.FilePath.RelativeToAbsolutePath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This helper method can be used to convert a relative path to an absolute path based on the given base path.
member.returns: An absolute path
member.remarks: If the base path is null or empty, the current working folder is used.

example.code:
Dim basePath As String = "E:\DotNet\CS\TestProject\Source" Dim relativePath As String = "..\Doc\Help.html"
Dim absolutePath As String = _ FilePath.RelativeToAbsolutePath(basePath, relativePath);
Console.WriteLine(absolutePath)
' Results in: E:\DotNet\CS\TestProject\Doc\Help.html

member.value: If no has been specified, this returns the current directory.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.FilePath.Path
member.summary: This is used to get or set the path to use.
member.value:
When set, if the path is not rooted (a relative path), is set to false. If rooted (an absolute path), it is not changed. This property always returns a fully qualified path but without any environment variable expansions.
If set to a null or empty string, the file path is cleared and is considered to be undefined.
member.note: MSBuild environment variable references are also supported (i.e. $(DXROOT), $(OutputPath), etc.). However, they will only be resolved if the resolves them.

example.code:
Dim path As New FilePath()
' Set it to a relative path path.Path = "..\..\Test.txt"
' Set it to an absolute path path.Path = "C:\My Documents\Info.doc"
' Set it to a path based on an environment variable path.Path = "%HOMEDRIVE%%HOMEPATH%\Favorites\*.*"

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.FilePath.PersistablePath
member.summary: This is used to retrieve the file path in a format suitable for persisting to storage based on the current settings.
member.remarks: If is true, an absolute path is always returned. If false, the path is returned in a form that is relative to the path stored in the property.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.FilePath.Exists
member.summary: This read-only property can be used to determine whether or not the file path exists.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.FilePath.ExpandedPath
member.summary: This read-only property is used to display the fully qualified path with environment variable expansions in the designer.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.FilePath.IsFixedPath
member.summary: This is used to indicate whether or not the path will be treated as a relative or fixed path when converted retrieved via the property.
member.value: If true, the path is returned as a fixed path when retrieved. If false, it is returned as a path relative to the current value of the property.

member.summary: Constructor. Assign the specified path and fixed setting.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.FolderPath.Path
member.summary: This is used to get or set the path.
member.value:
When set, if the path is not rooted (a relative path), is set to false. If rooted (an absolute path), it is not changed. This property always returns a fully qualified path but without any environment variable expansions and terminated with a trailing backslash if needed.
If set to a null or empty string, the folder path is cleared and is considered to be undefined.

example.code:
Dim path As New FolderPath()
' Set it to a relative path path.Path = "..\..\ProjectFolder"
' Set it to an absolute path path.Path = "C:\My Documents\ProjectDocs\"
' Set it to a path based on an environment variable path.Path = "%HOMEDRIVE%%HOMEPATH%\Favorites\"

member.summary: This class is used to hold the conceptual content settings for a project during a build and for editing.

member.summary: Constructor
member.param: The project from which to load the settings

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ConceptualContent.ConceptualContentSettings.CopyContentFiles(SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.BuildProcess)
member.summary: This is used to copy the additional content token, image, and topic files to the build folder.
member.remarks: This will copy the code snippet file if specified, save token information to a shared content file called _Tokens_.xml in the build process's working folder, copy the image files to the .\media folder in the build process's working folder, save the media map to a file called _MediaContent_.xml in the build process's working folder, and save the topic files to the .\ddueXml folder in the build process's working folder. The topic files will have their content wrapped in a <topic> tag if needed and will be named using their value.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ConceptualContent.ConceptualContentSettings.CreateConfigurationFiles(SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.BuildProcess)
member.summary: This is used to create the conceptual content build configuration files.
member.remarks: This will create the companion files used to resolve conceptual links and the _ContentMetadata_.xml and ConceptualManifest.xml configuration files.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ConceptualContent.ConceptualContentSettings.CreateCompanionFiles(SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.BuildProcess)
member.summary: This is used to create the companion files used to resolve conceptual links.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ConceptualContent.ConceptualContentSettings.CreateContentMetadata(SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.BuildProcess)
member.summary: Create the content metadata file
member.remarks:
The content metadata file contains metadata information for each topic such as its title, table of contents title, help attributes, and index keywords. Help attributes are a combination of the project-level help attributes and any parsed from the topic file. Any replacement tags in the token values will be replaced with the appropriate project values.
A true MAML version of this file contains several extra attributes. Since Sandcastle doesn't use them, I'm not going to waste time adding them. The only stuff written is what is required by Sandcastle. In addition, I'm putting the title and PBM_FileVersion item elements in here rather than use the separate companion files. They all end up in the metadata section of the topic being built so this saves having two extra components in the configuration that do the same thing with different files.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ConceptualContent.ConceptualContentSettings.CreateConceptualManifest(SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.BuildProcess)
member.summary: Create the content metadata file
member.remarks: The content metadata file contains metadata information for each topic such as its title, table of contents title, help attributes, and index keywords. Help attributes are a combination of the project-level help attributes and any parsed from the topic file. Any replacement tags in the token values will be replaced with the appropriate project values.

member.name: T:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.NamingMethod
member.summary: This public enumerated type defines the naming method to use for the help topic filenames.

member.name: F:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.NamingMethod.Guid
member.summary: Use the default GUID file naming method.

member.name: F:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.NamingMethod.MemberName
member.summary: Use the member name without parameters as the filename. The characters ":", ".", "#", and "`" in the name are replaced with an underscore (i.e. T:CustomType becomes T_CustomType, M:CustomType.#ctor becomes M_CustomType__ctor, P:CustomType.Property becomes P:CustomType_Property, etc). Duplicate names will have an incrementing value appended to the end of the name (i.e. M_CustomType_Method, M_CustomType.Method_1, M_CustomType_Method_2, etc).

member.name: F:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.NamingMethod.HashedMemberName
member.summary: Use the hashed member name without parameters as the filename. No character replacements are made for this option and the GetHashCode method is used to generate the hash value and it is formatted as a hex value. This is useful for extremely long type names that cause the filename to exceed the maximum length when the full path is included. Duplicate names will have an incrementing value appended to the name prior to creating the hash value as needed.

member.name: T:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Controls.StatusBarTextProvider
member.summary: This is an component that allows you to add status bar text for menu items and form controls. When built for use with .NET 2.0, it also supports adding status bar text for menu strip, tool strip, and status strip components.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Controls.StatusBarTextProvider.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor
member.overloads: There are two overloads for the constructor

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Controls.StatusBarTextProvider.#ctor(System.ComponentModel.IContainer)
member.summary: Constructor. This one takes a reference to a container.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Controls.StatusBarTextProvider.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.
member.param: True to release both managed and unmanaged resources, false to just release unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Controls.StatusBarTextProvider.CanExtend(System.Object)
member.summary: This is implemented to determine if the component can be extended with the extra properties.
member.returns: True if it can be extended, false if not
member.remarks: components and everything derived from ToolStripItem (.NET 2.0) and are extended with the StatusBarText and ShowAsBlank properties with the following exceptions: Form, Label, PictureBox, ProgressBar, ScrollBar, Splitter, StatusBar, ToolBar, ToolStrip (.NET 2.0) and controls derived from them. The Form contain controls and the other controls cannot receive the focus needed to display the text so there is no point in giving them status bar text. The exception to the above rule is LinkLabel which can receive the focus and thus can be extended. ToolStripItem components are only supported when built for use with .NET 2.0.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Controls.StatusBarTextProvider.GetStatusBarText(System.ComponentModel.Component)
member.summary: This is used to retrieve the status bar text for a component.
member.param: The component for which to get the status bar text
member.returns: The message string if found or null if not found
member.exception: This is thrown if the component is null or if it is not a menu item, control, or a tool strip item.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Controls.StatusBarTextProvider.SetStatusBarText(System.ComponentModel.Component,System.String)
member.summary: This stores the status bar text for the specified component.
member.param: The component associated with the message
The status bar text for the component
member.remarks: The designer converts strings containing nothing but spaces to empty strings and won't serialize them to code. If you want a blank string to display, use to set the "show as blank" flag to true instead.
member.exception: This is thrown if the component is null or if it is not a menu item, control, or a tool strip item.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Controls.StatusBarTextProvider.GetShowAsBlank(System.ComponentModel.Component)
member.summary: This is used to retrieve the "show as blank" flag for a menu item or control.
member.param: The item for which to get the flag
member.returns: True if it will show a blank status bar message or false if not.
member.exception: This is thrown if the component is null or if it is not a menu item, control, or a tool strip item.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Controls.StatusBarTextProvider.SetShowAsBlank(System.ComponentModel.Component,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This stores the "show as blank" flag for the specified component.
member.param: The component associated with the property
The flag value for the component
member.remarks: The designer converts strings containing nothing but spaces to empty strings and this equates to the default and the value is not serialized to code. If you want a blank string to display, set this property to true instead. This property takes precedence over the StatusBarText property.
member.exception: This is thrown if the component is null or if it is not a menu item, control, or a tool strip item.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Controls.StatusBarTextProvider.ApplicationStatusBar
member.summary: This is used to set or get the default status bar component to use for displaying the status bar text messages.
member.value: This property is static and must be set at some point during application initialization. This component will be used unless the property is set to override it.
member.exception: This is thrown if the object is not a status bar control or a tool strip item.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Controls.StatusBarTextProvider.ApplicationDisplayPanel
member.summary: This is used to set or get the status bar panel in which to display the messages in the common application status bar.
member.value:
This property is static and must be set at some point during application initialization. This display panel will be used unless the property is set to override the status bar used. In that case, the is used instead.
The default is zero (the first panel). If the status bar does not have panels, the index exceeds the panel count, or the status bar's property is false, messages will be shown in the status bar's Text property instead. This property is ignored if using a tool strip item to display the text.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Controls.StatusBarTextProvider.ApplicationDefaultText
member.summary: This is used to set or get the default text to show when no item has the focus or no status text for the application status bar.
member.value: By default, it will be set to the text in the selected status bar component. If you set it to a different value, set this property after specifying the status bar control to use.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Controls.StatusBarTextProvider.StatusLabel
member.summary: This is used to get or set the tool strip status label component that can be used to display a status message in conjunction with the component.
member.remarks: This property is only available when used with .NET 2.0.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Controls.StatusBarTextProvider.ProgressBar
member.summary: This is used to get or set the tool strip progress bar component that can be used to display progress through a long running task.
member.remarks: This can be used in conjunction with . This property is only available when used with .NET 2.0.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Controls.StatusBarTextProvider.InstanceStatusBar
member.summary: This is used to get or set the status bar component to use for this instance.
member.value: If not set or set to null, it will use the status bar control assigned to the property.
member.exception: This is thrown if the object is not a status bar control or a tool strip item.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Controls.StatusBarTextProvider.InstanceDisplayPanel
member.summary: This is used to set or get the status bar panel in which to display the messages when the property is set to a status bar.
member.value: The default is zero (the first panel). If the status bar does not have panels, the index exceeds the panel count, or the status bar's property is false, messages will be shown in the status bar's Text property instead. If using the , this property is ignored. It is also ignored if using a tool strip item to display the text.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Controls.StatusBarTextProvider.InstanceDefaultText
member.summary: This is used to set or get the default text to show when no item has the focus or no status text for the instance status bar.
member.value: By default, it will be set to the text in the selected status bar component. If set to a different value, set this property after specifying the status bar control to use.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ConceptualContent.TopicCollection.AddTopicsFromFolder(System.String,System.String,SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject)
member.summary: Add all topics from the specified folder recursively to the collection and to the given project file.
member.param: The folder from which to get the files
The project to which the files are added
member.remarks: Only actual conceptual content topic files are added. They must have a ".aml" extension and must be one of the valid document types. Folders will be added as sub-topics recursively. If a file with the same name as the folder exists, it will be associated with the container node. If no such file exists, an empty container node is created.

member.remarks: Words in the exclusion list, those that are less than three characters long, and anything starting with a digit will not appear in the index.

member.name: T:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.MSBuild.BuildHelp
member.summary: This task is used to build help file output using the Sandcastle Help File Builder.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.MSBuild.BuildHelp.Execute
member.summary: This is used to execute the task and perform the build
member.returns: True on success or false on failure.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.MSBuild.BuildHelp.GetCurrentProject
member.summary: This is used to obtain a reference to the project that is currently being built.
member.returns: The current project if possible or null if it could not be obtained.
member.remarks: The build engine provides no way to get a reference to the current project. As such, we have to resort to reflection to get it. This was much easier under .NET 2.0 as the project was a project of the BuildEngine object. The .NET 3.5 build engine hides it way down in the object hierarchy. We could build the project without it but we lose the ability to use command line overrides and changes to user-defined properties.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.MSBuild.BuildHelp.buildProcess_BuildStepChanged(System.Object,SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.BuildProgressEventArgs)
member.summary: This is called by the build process thread to update the application with the current build step.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.MSBuild.BuildHelp.buildProcess_BuildProgress(System.Object,SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.BuildProgressEventArgs)
member.summary: This is called by the build process thread to update the task with information about progress.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.MSBuild.BuildHelp.ProjectFile
member.summary: This is used to pass in the project filename
member.remarks: Since already wraps the MSBuild project, it seemed redundant to define each and every property on this task and map them to the project properties. As such, this task will attempt to use the executing project to create the Sandcastle project instance. If that fails or is true, this file will be loaded instead. The downside is that property overrides on the command line will be ignored.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.MSBuild.BuildHelp.Configuration
member.summary: This is used to pass in the configuration to use for the build

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.MSBuild.BuildHelp.Platform
member.summary: This is used to pass in the platform to use for the build

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.MSBuild.BuildHelp.OutDir
member.summary: This is used to specify the output directory containing the build output for solution and project documentation sources when using Team Build.
member.value: This property is optional. If not specified, the default output path in project file documentation sources will be used.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.MSBuild.BuildHelp.Verbose
member.summary: This is used to set or get the output logging verbosity flag
member.value: This property is optional. If set to false (the default), only build steps are written to the task log. If set to true, all output from the build process is written to the task log.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.MSBuild.BuildHelp.DumpLogOnFailure
member.summary: This is used to set or get whether the log file is dumped to the task log if the help file project build fails.
member.value: This property is optional. If set to false (the default), the log is not dumped if the build fails. If set to true, all output from the build process is written to the task log if the build fails.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.MSBuild.BuildHelp.AlwaysLoadProject
member.summary: This is used to specify whether or not to load the specified rather than use the executing project.
member.value: This property is optional. If set to false, the default, the executing project is used as the Sandcastle project to build. If set to true, the specified is loaded. In such cases, command line property overrides are ignored.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.XmlCommentsFile.FixupComments
member.summary: This is called to fixup the comments for C++ compiler generated XML comments files.
member.remarks: The C++ compiler generates method signatures that differ from the other .NET compilers for methods that take generics as parameters. These methods fail to get documented as they do not match the output of MRefBuilder. The C# and VB.NET compilers generate names that do match it and this option is not needed for comments files generated by them. The C++ compiler also has problems resolving references to some members if it hasn't seen them yet. These are prefixed with "!:" which is removed by the fix-up code.

member.name: T:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Design.EscapeValueAttribute
member.summary: This is used to mark a property that needs its value escaped when stored in an MSBuild project file.
member.remarks: MSBuild requires that the following characters be escaped in property values unless they are intended to be interpreted by the build engine: % * ? @ $ ( ) ; '. In addition, this attribute will cause the values to be HTML encoded so that any HTML characters, especially tag delimiters are not interpreted. MSBuild tends to add XML namespaces to things it thinks are XML elements.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Design.EscapeValueAttribute.Escape(System.String)
member.summary: This is used to HTML encode and escape an MSBuild property value.
member.returns: The HTML encoded escaped value

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Design.EscapeValueAttribute.Unescape(System.String)
member.summary: This is used to return an unescaped and HTML decoded MSBuild value
member.returns: The unescaped and HTML decoded value
member.remarks: MSBuild provides an escape method but no unescape method. Go figure.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Design.EscapeValueAttribute.OnEscapeMatch(System.Text.RegularExpressions.Match)
member.summary: This is used to convert the match to its unescaped character
member.returns: The unescaped character as a string

member.summary: Convert a hex character to its integer value
member.returns: The integer value
